page.title: 07KELSTON PARK WEST OF BATH
page.content: {Kelston Park}is about 3km from Bath. It is set in 6acres of {park land.}It was built by{John Wood}the younger in 1770 for Sir Caeser Hawkins, a famous surgeon. The first {water closet}was invented by owners of Kelston Park and can still be seen in a house in Kelston. It was seen by {Elizabeth 1} who then ordered one to be built in { {Hampton Court.}Kelston Park is now rented by the{Methodist Association}of Youth Clubs and is used as a residential training centre. 50 people sleep there and 21 staff are employed. There is a camp sight in a{hexagonal {walled garden}which is the only one in the West Country. During the war(1939-1945){Emperor {Haile Selassie}of{Abyssinia}lived at Kelston Park after he had fled from his own country-Ethiopia.
